   20: 
   21: -module(fun_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 bad_apply/1,bad_fun_call/1,badarity/1,ext_badarity/1,
   26:          bad_arglist/1,
   27: 	 equality/1,ordering/1,
   28: 	 fun_to_port/1,t_phash/1,t_phash2/1,md5/1,
   29: 	 refc/1,refc_ets/1,refc_dist/1,
   30: 	 const_propagation/1,t_arity/1,t_is_function2/1,
   31: 	 t_fun_info/1,t_fun_info_mfa/1,t_fun_to_list/1]).
   32: 
   33: -export([nothing/0]).
   34: 
   35: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   40: 
   41: 
   42: all() ->
   43:     [bad_apply, bad_fun_call, badarity, ext_badarity,
   44:      bad_arglist,
   45:      equality, ordering, fun_to_port, t_phash,
   46:      t_phash2, md5, refc, refc_ets, refc_dist,
   47:      const_propagation, t_arity, t_is_function2, t_fun_info,
   48:      t_fun_info_mfa,t_fun_to_list].
   49: 
   50: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   53:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   54: 
   55: 
   56: %% Test that the correct EXIT code is returned for all types of bad funs.
   57: bad_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   58:     bad_apply_fc(42, [0]),
   59:     bad_apply_fc(xx, [1]),
   60:     bad_apply_fc({}, [2]),
   61:     bad_apply_fc({1}, [3]),
   62:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3}, [4]),
   63:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3}, [5]),
   64:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4}, [6]),
   65:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4,5,6}, [7]),
   66:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4,5}, [8]),
   67:     bad_apply_badarg({1,2}, [9]),
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: bad_apply_fc(Fun, Args) ->
   71:     Res = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
   72:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   73:     erlang:yield(),
   74:     case Res of
   75: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
   76: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
   77: 	Other ->
   78: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
   79: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Other})
   80:     end.
   81: 
   82: bad_apply_badarg(Fun, Args) ->
   83:     Res = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
   84:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   85:     erlang:yield(),
   86:     case Res of
   87: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
   88: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
   89: 	Other ->
   90: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
   91: 	    ct:fail({bad_result, Other})
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: %% Try directly calling bad funs.
   95: bad_fun_call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     bad_call_fc(42),
   97:     bad_call_fc(xx),
   98:     bad_call_fc({}),
   99:     bad_call_fc({1}),
  100:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3}),
  101:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3}),
  102:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4}),
  103:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4,5,6}),
  104:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4,5}),
  105:     bad_call_fc({1,2}),
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: bad_call_fc(Fun) ->
  109:     Args = [some,stupid,args],
  110:     Res = (catch Fun(Fun(Args))),
  111:     case Res of
  112: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
  113: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  114: 	Other ->
  115: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  116: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Other})
  117:     end.
  118: 
  119: % Test erlang:apply with non-proper arg-list
  120: bad_arglist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     Fun = fun(A,B) -> A+B end,
  122:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, 17)),
  123:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, [17|18])),
  124:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, [17,18|19])),
  125:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, 17)),
  126:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, [17|18])),
  127:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, [17,18|19])),
  128:     ok.
  129: 
  130: 
  131: %% Call and apply valid funs with wrong number of arguments.
  132: 
  133: badarity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     Fun = fun() -> ok end,
  135:     Stupid = {stupid,arguments},
  136:     Args = [some,{stupid,arguments},here],
  137: 
  138:     %% Simple call.
  139: 
  140:     Res = (catch Fun(some, Stupid, here)),
  141:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  142:     erlang:yield(),
  143:     case Res of
  144: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  145: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  146: 	_ ->
  147: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  148: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res})
  149:     end,
  150: 
  151:     %% Apply.
  152: 
  153:     Res2 = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
  154:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  155:     erlang:yield(),
  156:     case Res2 of
  157: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  158: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]);
  159: 	_ ->
  160: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]),
  161: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res2})
  162:     end,
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: %% Call and apply valid external funs with wrong number of arguments.
  166: 
  167: ext_badarity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168:     Fun = fun ?MODULE:nothing/0,
  169:     Stupid = {stupid,arguments},
  170:     Args = [some,{stupid,arguments},here],
  171: 
  172:     %% Simple call.
  173: 
  174:     Res = (catch Fun(some, Stupid, here)),
  175:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  176:     erlang:yield(),
  177:     case Res of
  178: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  179: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  180: 	_ ->
  181: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  182: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res})
  183:     end,
  184: 
  185:     %% Apply.
  186: 
  187:     Res2 = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
  188:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  189:     erlang:yield(),
  190:     case Res2 of
  191: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  192: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]);
  193: 	_ ->
  194: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]),
  195: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res2})
  196:     end,
  197:     ok.
  198: 
  199: nothing() ->
  200:     ok.
  201: 
  202: %% Test equality of funs.
  203: 
  204: equality(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     F0 = fun() -> 1 end,
  206:     F0_copy = copy_term(F0),
  207:     true = eq(F0, F0),
  208:     true = eq(F0, F0_copy),
  209: 
  210:     %% Compare different arities.
  211:     F1 = fun(X) -> X + 1 end,
  212:     true = eq(F1, F1),
  213:     false = eq(F0, F1),
  214:     false = eq(F0_copy, F1),
  215: 
  216:     %% Compare different environments.
  217:     G1 = make_fun(1),
  218:     G2 = make_fun(2),
  219:     true = eq(G1, G1),
  220:     true = eq(G2, G2),
  221:     false = eq(G1, G2),
  222:     false = eq(G2, G1),
  223:     G1_copy = copy_term(G1),
  224:     true = eq(G1, G1_copy),
  225: 
  226:     %% Compare fun with binaries.
  227:     B = list_to_binary([7,8,9]),
  228:     false = eq(B, G1),
  229:     false = eq(G1, B),
  230: 
  231:     %% Compare external funs.
  232:     FF0 = fun aa:blurf/0,
  233:     FF0_copy = copy_term(FF0),
  234:     FF1 = fun erlang:abs/0,
  235:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  236:     FF3 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  237:     FF4 = fun z:ff/0,
  238: 
  239:     true = eq(FF0, FF0),
  240:     true = eq(FF0, FF0_copy),
  241:     true = eq(FF1, FF1),
  242:     true = eq(FF2, FF2),
  243:     true = eq(FF3, FF3),
  244:     true = eq(FF4, FF4),
  245:     false = eq(FF0, FF1),
  246:     false = eq(FF0, FF2),
  247:     false = eq(FF0, FF3),
  248:     false = eq(FF0, FF4),
  249:     false = eq(FF1, FF0),
  250:     false = eq(FF1, FF2),
  251:     false = eq(FF1, FF3),
  252:     false = eq(FF1, FF4),
  253:     false = eq(FF2, FF3),
  254:     false = eq(FF2, FF4),
  255:     false = eq(FF3, FF4),
  256: 
  257:     %% EEP37
  258:     H1 = fun Fact(N) when N > 0 -> N * Fact(N - 1); Fact(0) -> 1 end,
  259:     H2 = fun Pow(N, M) when M > 0 -> N * Pow(N, M - 1); Pow(_, 0) -> 1 end,
  260:     H1_copy = copy_term(H1),
  261: 
  262:     true = eq(H1, H1),
  263:     true = eq(H1, H1_copy),
  264:     true = eq(H2, H2),
  265:     false = eq(H1, H2),
  266: 
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: eq(X, X) -> true;
  270: eq(_, _) -> false.
  271: 
  272: copy_term(Term) ->
  273:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  274: 
  275: make_fun(X) ->
  276:     fun() -> X end.
  277: 	    
  278: %% Tests ordering of funs.
  279: ordering(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     F1 = make_fun(1, 2),
  281:     F1_copy = copy_term(F1),
  282:     F2 = make_fun(1, 3),
  283:     F3 = make_fun(3, 4),
  284: 
  285:     FF0 = fun aa:blurf/0,
  286:     FF1 = fun erlang:abs/0,
  287:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  288:     FF3 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  289:     FF4 = fun z:ff/0,
  290: 
  291:     true = FF0 < FF1,
  292:     true = FF1 < FF2,
  293:     true = FF2 < FF3,
  294:     true = FF3 < FF4,
  295: 
  296:     true = FF0 > F1,
  297:     true = FF0 > F2,
  298:     true = FF0 > F3,
  299:     true = FF4 > F1,
  300:     true = FF4 > F2,
  301:     true = FF4 > F3,
  302: 
  303:     true = F1 == F1,
  304:     true = F1 == F1_copy,
  305:     true = F1 /= F2,
  306: 
  307:     true = F1 < F2,
  308:     true = F2 > F1,
  309:     true = F2 < F3,
  310:     true = F3 > F2,
  311: 
  312:     false = F1 > F2,
  313:     false = F2 > F3,
  314: 
  315:     %% Compare with binaries.
  316: 
  317:     B = list_to_binary([7,8,9,10]),
  318:     false = B == F1,
  319:     false = F1 == B,
  320: 
  321:     true = F1 < B,
  322:     true = B > F2,
  323: 
  324:     false = F1 > B,
  325:     false = B < F2,
  326: 
  327:     false = F1 >= B,
  328:     false = B =< F2,
  329: 
  330:     %% Compare module funs with binaries.
  331:     false = B == FF1,
  332:     false = FF1 == B,
  333: 
  334:     true = FF1 < B,
  335:     true = B > FF2,
  336: 
  337:     false = FF1 > B,
  338:     false = B < FF2,
  339: 
  340:     false = FF1 >= B,
  341:     false = B =< FF2,
  342: 
  343:     %% Create a port and ref.
  344: 
  345:     Path = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  346:     AFile = filename:join(Path, "vanilla_file"),
  347:     P = open_port(AFile, [out]),
  348:     R = make_ref(),
  349: 
  350:     %% Compare funs with ports and refs.
  351: 
  352:     true = R < F3,
  353:     true = F3 > R,
  354:     true = F3 < P,
  355:     true = P > F3,
  356: 
  357:     true = R =< F3,
  358:     true = F3 >= R,
  359:     true = F3 =< P,
  360:     true = P >= F3,
  361: 
  362:     false = R > F3,
  363:     false = F3 < R,
  364:     false = F3 > P,
  365:     false = P < F3,
  366: 
  367:     %% Compare funs with conses and nils.
  368: 
  369:     true = F1 < [a],
  370:     true = F1 < [],
  371:     true = [a,b] > F1,
  372:     true = [] > F1,
  373: 
  374:     false = [1] < F1,
  375:     false = [] < F1,
  376:     false = F1 > [2],
  377:     false = F1 > [],
  378: 
  379:     false = [1] =< F1,
  380:     false = [] =< F1,
  381:     false = F1 >= [2],
  382:     false = F1 >= [],
  383: 
  384:     %% Compare module funs with conses and nils.
  385: 
  386:     true = FF1 < [a],
  387:     true = FF1 < [],
  388:     true = [a,b] > FF1,
  389:     true = [] > FF1,
  390: 
  391:     false = [1] < FF1,
  392:     false = [] < FF1,
  393:     false = FF1 > [2],
  394:     false = FF1 > [],
  395: 
  396:     false = [1] =< FF1,
  397:     false = [] =< FF1,
  398:     false = FF1 >= [2],
  399:     false = FF1 >= [],
  400:     ok.
  401: 
  402: make_fun(X, Y) ->
  403:     fun(A) -> A*X+Y end.
  404: 
  405: %% Try sending funs to ports (should fail).
  406: fun_to_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  407:     fun_to_port(Config, xxx),
  408:     fun_to_port(Config, fun() -> 42 end),
  409:     fun_to_port(Config, [fun() -> 43 end]),
  410:     fun_to_port(Config, [1,fun() -> 44 end]),
  411:     fun_to_port(Config, [0,1|fun() -> 45 end]),
  412:     B64K = build_io_list(65536),
  413:     fun_to_port(Config, [B64K,fun() -> 45 end]),
  414:     fun_to_port(Config, [B64K|fun() -> 45 end]),
  415:     ok.
  416: 
  417: fun_to_port(Config, IoList) ->
  418:     Path = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  419:     AFile = filename:join(Path, "vanilla_file"),
  420:     Port = open_port(AFile, [out]),
  421:     case catch port_command(Port, IoList) of
  422: 	{'EXIT',{badarg,_}} -> ok;
  423: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_retval,Other})
  424:     end.
  425: 
  426: build_io_list(0) -> [];
  427: build_io_list(1) -> [7];
  428: build_io_list(N) ->
  429:     L = build_io_list(N div 2),
  430:     case N rem 2 of
  431: 	0 -> [L|L];
  432: 	1 -> [7,L|L]
  433:     end.
  434: 
  435: %% Test the phash/2 BIF on funs.
  436: t_phash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  437:     F1 = fun(_X) -> 1 end,
  438:     F2 = fun(_X) -> 2 end,
  439:     true = phash(F1) /= phash(F2),
  440: 
  441:     G1 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  442:     G2 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  443:     G3 = make_fun(1, 2, 4),
  444:     true = phash(G1) == phash(G2),
  445:     true = phash(G2) /= phash(G3),
  446: 
  447:     FF0 = fun erlang:abs/1,
  448:     FF1 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  449:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  450:     FF3 = fun blurf:exit/2,
  451:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF1),
  452:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF2),
  453:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF3),
  454:     true = phash(FF1) =/= phash(FF2),
  455:     true = phash(FF1) =/= phash(FF3),
  456:     true = phash(FF2) =/= phash(FF3),
  457:     ok.
  458: 
  459: phash(Term) ->
  460:     erlang:phash(Term, 16#7ffffff).
  461: 
  462: %% Test the phash2/2 BIF on funs.
  463: t_phash2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  464:     F1 = fun(_X) -> 1 end,
  465:     F2 = fun(_X) -> 2 end,
  466:     true = phash2(F1) /= phash2(F2),
  467: 
  468:     G1 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  469:     G2 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  470:     G3 = make_fun(1, 2, 4),
  471:     true = phash2(G1) == phash2(G2),
  472:     true = phash2(G2) /= phash2(G3),
  473: 
  474:     FF0 = fun erlang:abs/1,
  475:     FF1 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  476:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  477:     FF3 = fun blurf:exit/2,
  478:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF1),
  479:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF2),
  480:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF3),
  481:     true = phash2(FF1) =/= phash2(FF2),
  482:     true = phash2(FF1) =/= phash2(FF3),
  483:     true = phash2(FF2) =/= phash2(FF3),
  484:     
  485:     ok.
  486: 
  487: phash2(Term) ->
  488:     erlang:phash2(Term, 16#7ffffff).
  489: 
  490: make_fun(X, Y, Z) ->
  491:     fun() -> {X,Y,Z} end.
  492: 
  493: %% Test that MD5 bifs reject funs properly.
  494: md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     _ = size(erlang:md5_init()),
  496: 
  497:     %% Try funs in the i/o list.
  498:     bad_md5(fun(_X) -> 42 end),
  499:     bad_md5([fun(_X) -> 43 end]),
  500:     bad_md5([1,fun(_X) -> 44 end]),
  501:     bad_md5([1|fun(_X) -> 45 end]),
  502:     B64K = build_io_list(65536),
  503:     bad_md5([B64K,fun(_X) -> 46 end]),
  504:     bad_md5([B64K|fun(_X) -> 46 end]),
  505:     ok.
  506:     
  507: bad_md5(Bad) ->
  508:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:md5(Bad)).
  509: 
  510: refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     F1 = fun_factory(2),
  512:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  513:     F2 = fun_factory(42),
  514:     {refc,3} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  515: 
  516:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  517:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> {refc,4} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc) end),
  518:     receive
  519: 	{'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok;
  520: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  521:     end,
  522:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  523:     %% Wait to make sure that the process has terminated completely.
  524:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  525:     {refc,3} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  526: 
  527:     %% Garbage collect. Only the F2 fun will be left.
  528:     7 = F1(5),
  529:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  530:     40 = F2(-2),
  531:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F2, refc),
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: fun_factory(Const) ->
  535:     fun(X) -> X + Const end.
  536: 
  537: refc_ets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     F = fun(X) -> X + 33 end,
  539:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F, refc),
  540: 
  541:     refc_ets_set(F, [set]),
  542:     refc_ets_set(F, [ordered_set]),
  543:     refc_ets_bag(F, [bag]),
  544:     refc_ets_bag(F, [duplicate_bag]),
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: refc_ets_set(F1, Options) ->
  548:     io:format("~p", [Options]),
  549:     Tab = ets:new(kalle, Options),
  550:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,F1}),
  551:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  552:     [{a_key,F3}] = ets:lookup(Tab, a_key),
  553:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  554:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,not_a_fun}),
  555:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  556:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {another_key,F1}),
  557:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  558:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  559:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  560:     10 = F3(-23),
  561:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  562:     2 = fun_refc(F1),
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: refc_ets_bag(F1, Options) ->
  566:     io:format("~p", [Options]),
  567:     Tab = ets:new(kalle, Options),
  568:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,F1}),
  569:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  570:     [{a_key,F3}] = ets:lookup(Tab, a_key),
  571:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  572:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,not_a_fun}),
  573:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  574:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {another_key,F1}),
  575:     5 = fun_refc(F1),
  576:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  577:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  578:     10 = F3(-23),
  579:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  580:     2 = fun_refc(F1),
  581:     ok.
  582: 
  583: refc_dist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  585:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  586:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() -> receive
  587:                                         Fun when is_function(Fun) ->
  588:                                             3 = fun_refc(Fun),
  589:                                             exit({normal,Fun}) end
  590:                            end),
  591:     F = fun() -> 42 end,
  592:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  593:     Pid ! F,
  594:     F2 = receive
  595: 	     {'EXIT',Pid,{normal,Fun}} -> Fun;
  596: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  597: 	 end,
  598:     %% dist.c:net_mess2 have a reference to Fun for a while since
  599:     %% Fun is passed in an exit signal. Wait until it is gone.
  600:     wait_until(fun () -> 4 =/= fun_refc(F2) end),
  601:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  602:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  603:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  604:     refc_dist_send(Node, F),
  605:     peer:stop(Peer).
  606: 
  607: refc_dist_send(Node, F) ->
  608:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() -> receive
  609:                                         {To,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  610:                                             wait_until(fun () ->
  611:                                                                3 =:= fun_refc(Fun)
  612:                                                        end),
  613:                                             To ! Fun
  614:                                     end
  615:                            end),
  616:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  617:     Pid ! {self(),F},
  618:     F2 = receive
  619: 	     Fun when is_function(Fun) -> Fun;
  620: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  621: 	 end,
  622:     receive {'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok end,
  623:     %% No reference from dist.c:net_mess2 since Fun is passed
  624:     %% in an ordinary message.
  625:     3 = fun_refc(F),
  626:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  627:     refc_dist_reg_send(Node, F).
  628: 
  629: refc_dist_reg_send(Node, F) ->
  630:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  631:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  632:     Ref = make_ref(),
  633:     Me = self(),
  634:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
  635:                                    true = register(my_fun_tester, self()),
  636:                                    Me ! Ref,
  637:                                    receive
  638:                                        {Me,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  639:                                            3 = fun_refc(Fun),
  640:                                            Me ! Fun
  641:                                    end
  642:                            end),
  643:     erlang:yield(),
  644:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  645:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  646:     {my_fun_tester,Node} ! {self(),F},
  647:     F2 = receive
  648: 	     Fun when is_function(Fun) -> Fun;
  649: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  650: 	 end,
  651:     receive {'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok end,
  652: 
  653:     3 = fun_refc(F),
  654:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  655:     ok.
  656:     
  657: fun_refc(F) ->
  658:     {refc,Count} = erlang:fun_info(F, refc),
  659:     Count.
  660: 
  661: const_propagation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  662:     Fun1 = fun wait_until/1,
  663:     2 = fun_refc(Fun1),
  664:     Fun2 = Fun1,
  665:     my_cmp({Fun1,Fun2}),
  666: 
  667:     Fun3 = fun() -> ok end,
  668:     2 = fun_refc(Fun3),
  669:     Fun4 = Fun3,
  670:     my_cmp({Fun3,Fun4}),
  671:     ok.
  672: 
  673: my_cmp({Fun,Fun}) -> ok;
  674: my_cmp({Fun1,Fun2}) ->
  675:     io:format("Fun1: ~p", [erlang:fun_info(Fun1)]),
  676:     io:format("Fun2: ~p", [erlang:fun_info(Fun2)]),
  677:     ct:fail(no_match).
  678: 
  679: t_arity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  680:     0 = fun_arity(fun() -> ok end),
  681:     0 = fun_arity(fun() -> Config end),
  682:     1 = fun_arity(fun(X) -> X+1 end),
  683:     1 = fun_arity(fun(X) -> Config =:= X end),
  684:     A = id(42),
  685: 
  686:     %% Test that the arity is transferred properly.
  687:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  688:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  689:     hello_world = spawn_call(Node, fun() -> hello_world end),
  690:     0 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X) -> X end),
  691:     42 = spawn_call(Node, fun(_X) -> A end),
  692:     43 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y) -> A+X+Y end),
  693:     1 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y) -> X+Y end),
  694:     45 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y, Z) -> A+X+Y+Z end),
  695:     peer:stop(Peer),
  696:     ok.
  697: 
  698: t_is_function2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  699:     false = is_function(id({a,b}), 0),
  700:     false = is_function(id({a,b}), 234343434333433433),
  701:     true = is_function(fun() -> ok end, 0),
  702:     true = is_function(fun(_) -> ok end, 1),
  703:     false = is_function(fun(_) -> ok end, 0),
  704: 
  705:     true = is_function(fun erlang:abs/1, 1),
  706:     true = is_function(fun erlang:abs/99, 99),
  707:     false = is_function(fun erlang:abs/1, 0),
  708:     false = is_function(fun erlang:abs/99, 0),
  709: 
  710:     false = is_function(id(self()), 0),
  711:     false = is_function(id({a,b,c}), 0),
  712:     false = is_function(id({a}), 0),
  713:     false = is_function(id([a,b,c]), 0),
  714: 
  715:     %% Bad arity argument.
  716:     bad_arity(a),
  717:     bad_arity(-1),
  718:     bad_arity(-9738974938734938793873498378),
  719:     bad_arity([]),
  720:     bad_arity(fun() -> ok end),
  721:     bad_arity({}),
  722:     bad_arity({a,b}),
  723:     bad_arity(self()),
  724: 
  725:     %% Bad arity argument in guard test.
  726:     Fun = fun erlang:abs/1,
  727:     ok = if
  728:              is_function(Fun, -1) -> error;
  729:              is_function(Fun, 256) -> error;
  730:              is_function(Fun, a) -> error;
  731:              is_function(Fun, Fun) -> error;
  732:              true -> ok
  733:          end,
  734:     ok.
  735: 
  736: bad_arity(A) ->
  737:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch is_function(fun() -> ok end, A)),
  738:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch is_function(no_fun, A)),
  739:     ok.
  740: 
  741: t_fun_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  742:     F = fun t_fun_info/1,
  743:     try F(blurf) of
  744: 	      FAny ->
  745: 		  ct:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [FAny])
  746: 	  catch
  747: 	      error:function_clause -> ok
  748: 	  end,
  749:     {module,?MODULE} = erlang:fun_info(F, module),
  750:     case erlang:fun_info(F, name) of
  751: 	      undefined ->
  752: 		  ct:fail(no_fun_info);
  753: 	      _ -> ok
  754: 	  end,
  755:     {arity,1} = erlang:fun_info(F, arity),
  756:     {env,[]} = erlang:fun_info(F, env),
  757:     verify_not_undef(F, index),
  758:     verify_not_undef(F, uniq),
  759:     verify_not_undef(F, new_index),
  760:     verify_not_undef(F, new_uniq),
  761:     verify_not_undef(F, refc),
  762:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info(F, blurf)),    
  763: 
  764:     %% Module fun.
  765:     FF = fun ?MODULE:t_fun_info/1,
  766:     try FF(blurf) of
  767: 	      FFAny ->
  768: 		  ct:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [FFAny])
  769: 	  catch
  770: 	      error:function_clause -> ok
  771: 	  end,
  772: 
  773:     {module,?MODULE} = erlang:fun_info(FF, module),
  774:     {name,t_fun_info} = erlang:fun_info(FF, name),
  775:     {arity,1} = erlang:fun_info(FF, arity),
  776:     {env,[]} = erlang:fun_info(FF, env),
  777:     verify_undef(FF, index),
  778:     verify_undef(FF, uniq),
  779:     verify_undef(FF, new_index),
  780:     verify_undef(FF, new_uniq),
  781:     verify_undef(FF, refc),
  782:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info(FF, blurf)),
  783: 
  784:     %% Not fun.
  785:     bad_info(abc),
  786:     bad_info(42),
  787:     bad_info({fun erlang:list_to_integer/1}),
  788:     bad_info([42]),
  789:     bad_info([]),
  790:     bad_info(self()),
  791:     bad_info(<<>>),
  792:     bad_info(<<1,2>>),
  793:     ok.
  794: 
  795: t_fun_info_mfa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  796:     Fun1 = fun spawn_call/2,
  797:     {module,M1}  = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, module),
  798:     {name,F1}    = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, name),
  799:     {arity,A1}   = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, arity),
  800:     {M1,F1,A1=2} = erlang:fun_info_mfa(Fun1),
  801:     %% Module fun.
  802:     Fun2 = fun ?MODULE:t_fun_info/1,
  803:     {module,M2}  = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, module),
  804:     {name,F2}    = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, name),
  805:     {arity,A2}   = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, arity),
  806:     {M2,F2,A2=1} = erlang:fun_info_mfa(Fun2),
  807: 
  808:     %% Not fun.
  809:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info_mfa(id(d))),
  810:     ok.
  811: 
  812: t_fun_to_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  813:     "fun a:b/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun a:b/1),
  814:     "fun 'a-esc':'b-esc'/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun 'a-esc':'b-esc'/1),
  815:     "fun 'a-esc':b/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun 'a-esc':b/1),
  816:     "fun a:'b-esc'/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun a:'b-esc'/1),
  817:     ok.
  818: 
  819: bad_info(Term) ->
  820:     try	erlang:fun_info(Term, module) of
  821: 	Any ->
  822: 	    ict:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [Any])
  823:     catch
  824: 	error:badarg -> ok
  825:     end.
  826: 
  827: verify_undef(Fun, Tag) ->
  828:     {Tag,undefined} = erlang:fun_info(Fun, Tag).
  829: 
  830: verify_not_undef(Fun, Tag) ->
  831:     case erlang:fun_info(Fun, Tag) of
  832: 	{Tag,undefined} ->
  833: 	    ct:fail("tag ~w not defined in fun_info", [Tag]);
  834: 	{Tag,_} -> ok
  835:     end.
  836: 
  837: id(X) ->
  838:     X.
  839: 
  840: spawn_call(Node, AFun) ->
  841:     Parent = self(),
  842:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
  843:     Pid = spawn_link(Node,
  844: 		     fun() ->
  845: 			     receive
  846: 				 {Fun,Fun,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  847: 				     Arity = fun_arity(Fun),
  848: 				     Args = case Arity of
  849: 						0 -> [];
  850: 						_ -> lists:seq(0, Arity-1)
  851: 					    end,
  852: 				     Res = apply(Fun, Args),
  853:                      case erlang:fun_info(Fun, pid) of
  854:                         {pid,Init} -> Parent ! {result,Res};
  855:                         {pid,Creator} -> Creator ! {result,Res}
  856:                      end
  857: 			     end
  858: 		     end),
  859:     Pid ! {AFun,AFun,AFun},
  860:     Res = receive
  861: 	      {result,R} -> R;
  862: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message,Other})
  863: 	  after 10000 ->
  864: 		  ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_result)
  865: 	  end,
  866:     receive
  867: 	{'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok;
  868: 	Other2 -> ct:fail({bad_message_waiting_for_exit,Other2})
  869:     after 10000 ->
  870: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_exit)
  871:     end,
  872:     Res.
  873: 
  874: fun_arity(F) ->
  875:     {arity,Arity} = erlang:fun_info(F, arity),
  876:     Arity.
  877: 
  878: wait_until(Fun) ->
  879:     case catch Fun() of
  880: 	true -> ok;
  881: 	_ -> receive after 100 -> wait_until(Fun) end
  882:     end.
